availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: This is to authorize James B Moore to Keep a Coffee house, and retail liquor by the small for the space of Six months from the 6th day of March 1860. he having paid Twenty five Dollars license therefor -- He holding himself liable to all the pains & penalties in such cases provided by law, or imposed by the laws of Greensburg for any violation thereof -- Witness my hand. March 17th 1860

W. B. Allen clerk
B. T. Greensburg

I certify that the above is a true copy of coffee house license. issued to James B. Moore. March 17th 1860 by W B Allen clerk of Board Trustees Greensburg & filed with the papers in the Green Circuit Clerk office in the case of The Commonwealth of Kentucky vs James B Moore
Witness my hand hand this 1st day of March 1861

C. D. Moore Clerk
B. T. Greensburg Ky

State of Kentucky
Green County Sct

I Robert Marshall clerk of the Green County Court Certify that James B Moore this day applied for and obtained a license and paid the Tax required by law to keep a Coffee house in the Town of Greensburg County of Green
Therefore this is to license the said James B Moore to keep a Coffee house in the Town of Greensburg for one year from the date hereof with all the restrictions and requirements of the law
Given under my hand and seal of office this 31st day of May 1860

State of Kentucky
Green County sct
I Robert Marshall clerk of the Green County Court Certify that the foregoing is a true copy of the Coffee house license issued by me as clerk aforesaid to James B Moore
Given under my hand this 1st day of March 1861

J B Moore
To } copy Coffee House License
